name: National Biodiversity Data Centre
goal: The National Biodiversity Data Centre is a national body for the collection, collation, management and dissemination of biodiversity data for the Republic of Ireland. Established by the Heritage Council of Ireland (A statutory advisory council to the government) its provided a range of not-for-profit shared data management services to both the public and private sectors, on behalf of the Heritage Council. It operates a national online mapping and data portal for the publication of biodiversity data to inform conservation management and other decision-making process. It serves also as Ireland's node for the Global Biodiversity Information Facility, publishing open access data to the global GBIF data portal. It provides additional added value services in terms of analysis and reporting on aspects of biodiversity, including provision of Ireland's National Biodiversity Indicators and provision of advisory services on Invasive Species.
euInitiatives: The principal EU initiative currently followed by the National Biodiversity Data Centre is provision of data and advise in support of invasive species mitigation.
